Reviews.Title: “Cosy, warm and inviting - an echo from East Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Vralitigator
Reviews.Content: This gem has a rich history that hearkens back to the older days of a divided Berlin. It was a real discovery for us, and "Honeymoom" hotel lived up to its name. We enjoyed a delicious dinner at the companion hotel's restaurant and discovered how wonderful dining with the locals can really be. We enjoyed very comfortable accomodations, comparable to the luxury feel of a Westin, found our way around the safe and well-lit residential neighborhood nearby without any trouble, and enjoyed the close proximity to the U-bahn and S-bahn routes. Hotel reception was absolutely charming, and made us feel like old friends returning after a long time away. It was only a ten minute walk to the colorful pedestrian zone and a memorable stroll down Unter den Linden to the Brandenburg Gate, and we engaged a knowledgeable guide to show us the historical sights and memorials throughout the eastern sector on our second day. Perfect location for a visit to Berlin, especially if you plan to see much of the old East Berlin historical sights, the Stassi prison site, the majestic parliament (Reichstag),and stroll through the Tiergarten.

Reviews.Title: “very charming”
Reviews.Author: joop1
Reviews.Content: This is a very special place. We had an apartment in the garden, which was very nice. There were steep starirs to climb, but this had been announced by the hotel on beforehand when making the reservation, so that was our own choice. We definitely liked its location: quiet and still close to the lively places. Very much the feeling of a living neigbourhood in the former East Berlin. And of course the garden is magnificent. Also very pleasant are the homely breakfast and breakfast room(s). You have definitely not the feeling of staying in a big hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place near museum island”
Reviews.Author: runningman30
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights for the Berlin Marathon. The hotel is a nice mix of antique and modern, and the location is great. They have a secure parking facility, and the U-bahn and S-bahn train stations are a block away. S-bahn from here take about 10 minutes to get to Unter der Linden, Brandenburg Gate, the Reichstag, and the main downtown shopping district. If you want to go across town to Charlottenburg, the Zoo, etc. it takes about another 20 minutes with train changes. It is also only a ten minute walk from Museum Island, as well as 2 streets (Tor strasse and ??) that were full of restaurants and bars that stayed open with great nightlife until dawn.

Reviews.Title: “Cute and quirky hotel - great front desk”
Reviews.Author: acura3
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for three nights in September 2010. The gentleman at the front desk was great helping us navigate the city by public transportation. Our room was small but nice - a little out of the way - but we didn't mind and welcomed the exercise by walking.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - a little off the beaten path, but worth it!”
Reviews.Author: ReadyToGo27
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a little farther out of the "main" area of Berlin, but is a pleasant walk into the main tourist attractions. It's clean, the staff are friendly and happy to help. The one issue we had was no AC. They provided us with a fan - but had to use the one they had set up in the main lobby! The garden in the back is beautiful - perfect place to have breakfast and start the day. They also have a computer in the lobby for free internet. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely garden respite, service perfunctory to minimal”
Reviews.Author: mperse
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed for 7 nights, having booked 2 suites and a single room. The rooms were clean and somewhat quirky, as previously described. The garden was a real treat, a lovely place to relax and enjoy the daily included breakfasts. The desk service was, however, minimal and begrudging at best. Requests for information or help with dinner reservations etc. were met with abruptness or incomprehension. The phone itself in the room had to be rented (although once rented there was no charge for local calls). The suites were located on the 3rd and 4th floor (actually the 4th and 5th) with no one to help us up with our bags. Although there was a coffee machine on the ground floor that was always available, there was a charge to make a cup of coffee or tea, symptomatic of a lack of graciousness or the lack of providing any extra comforts to guests. All in all, none of us would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Quirk, charm, quiet - all I'd ever need”
Reviews.Author: signal38
Reviews.Content: I only stayed there two short nights, and in a single room, which was on the small side - but what I look for in a hotel is a comfortable and quiet sleep, and this I got in abundance. The room was charming, and overlooking the quiet and nice garden at the back (I have no idea how quiet the rooms at the front are however.) The location is, I think, quite good for a city the size of Berlin. Very close to the main train station, and I walked to the center very easily. I really enjoyed the place, and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely friendly (and quirky) hotel in nice central location”
Reviews.Author: vogel421
Reviews.Content: We loved this place. It's on the northerna edge of Mitte and has great transport links (two underground stations close by and trams and buses past the door) but actually with a tiny bit of energy you can just walk into town, which is pleasant and interesting. Our beautiful room was very comfortable and we liked the historic feeling of the building and its odd layout. As well as the old building there are some newer rooms out in the very pretty (and peaceful) garden, so I suppose those in the know could choose which sort of "feel" they wanted for their stay. There's no dinner but there are some fantastic restaurants nearby, including the "other" Honigmond round a couple of corners. Breakfast at the Honigmond Garden was excellent and effectively unlimited so you could eat for the day! The reception is nice and club-like and the staff are very pleasant and helpful. If we were lucky enough to return to Berlin we'd be back at this lovely hotel without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “With its enchanting garden in the middle of Berlin, this quiet and quirky hotel is in a class of its own”
Reviews.Author: MissusMagnolia
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the heart of Berlin, near the brand new Hauptbahnhof and within walking distance of many of the city's major museums, galleries, cafés and designer shops of Oranienburgerstrasse and Hackesche Höfe, the bookshops of Prenzlauer Berg, theatre and opera. It's just down the road from the magnificent old natural history museum and round the corner from the historic Dorotheenstädtischer Friedhof, the last resting place of writers, philosophers, actors, including Bertolt Brecht, Helene Weigel, Heinrich Mann, G.W.F. Hegel. From my suite of rooms on the third floor (no lift! good exercise! incredibly peaceful!) I looked down into the delightful oasis of the hotel garden: its pebble paths wind past trees and flowering bushes, a bridge crosses a small fish pond. Oskar the cat keeps an eye on fish, visiting birds and hotel guests. The rooms are bright, clean, and furnished rather theatrically, with an eclectic mix of history and humour. Falling asleep I had the choice of focussing on a large gold-framed painting of a high-seas battle between pirate ships or watching the wide-screen TV. There was a generous bathroom, a small but well-equipped kitchen, and a charming sitting area. The breakfasts were excellent, the staff extremely helpful, there's a computer for guests in the reception area, and a big bowl of chocolates. In some ways the Honigmond - the name means "honeymoon" - offers a little less than expected (rooms without telephone, and private internet access had to be purchased) but in important ways it offers much more. Its surprises and charm place it in a class of its own.

Reviews.Title: “Honigmond--highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: JamesQOL
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Honigmond Gardens for 2 weeks June-July 2008. We had a large apartment one floor above ground level overlooking the garden/courtyard. The apartment was pleasantly quaint/eclectic; the recently remodeled bathroom was first-rate. The staff are exceptionally nice. The garden is a treat...we enjoyed breakfast outside every morning except when the weather forced us inside. Breakfast features an excellent selection of pastries, cereals, juices, fruit, breads, meats, and cheeses. The apartment was quiet...like silent...throughout the evening and night. The Honigmond experience was nearly flawless (assuming that kind people, good food, quiet, and a beautiful garden meet your specifications for "flawless"). The clientele (during our stay, anyway) was predominantly German. This observation may relate to my only criticism of the Honigmond Gardens. No credit cards; only cash or one of several EU (only) debit cards. For an international visitor this was a pain in the behind; I wound up transferring the entire amount of a 14-night stay in advance to the Honigmond's bank (at E165 per night). I have no regrets whatsoever at having done so; it just was aggravating to manage the relationship between the Honigmond; the Honigmond's bank; and my bank. This is the only downside of staying at this privately (and excellently!) managed property. And I should note as well...the location is just about perfect: at the north side of Mitte a short walk or tram-ride from Prenzlauer-berg. If, like us, you're not a great fan of traditional German food but thrive on inexpensive, international, fusion-type food, you can't beat Prenzlauer-berg.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Friendly Staff, Fantastic Breakfast!!”
Reviews.Author: MissKim77
Reviews.Content: This hotel is worth every penny!! They've paid attention to all the details and it shows. The friendly staff makes you feel immediately welcomed. If you've got an early flight out and would otherwise miss breakfast, they'll pack a lunch for you to take along. The location is convenient for exploring Mitte and a short walk into Prenzlauer Berg. In response to an earlier review: there is now an elevator in the hotel. The rooms are extremely comfortable, quite, clean and artistically furnished.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon indeed”
Reviews.Author: 5StarBohemian
Reviews.Content: I reckon I needn't add to the reviews, but I want to show my support for this most charming hotel. If you don't mind climbing stairs (i don't) and you like a hotel with character, this is the right choice. The breakfast is lovely and the garden serene. Berlin is truely a spectacular city and this hotel adds to the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights at the Honigmond Garten Hotel and found it to be excellent. Our room overlooked the charming garden where we also ate breakfast every day from the well-stocked buffet included in the room price. Our room was a fairly modest size but the high ceilings and large window gave it an airy feel, the bathroom was quite spacious, plenty of hot water and a good shower. As we were there during world cup fever, the prices were much higher than usual, but less exorbitant than some of the chain hotels in the city. At the normal rate, this hotel offers excellent value for money. The location is great too, near Oranienburger strasse with lots of good restaurants and bars (try Thai Good Times restaurant at no 1 Chausseestr. which was excellent), and easy access to tube, tram or walking distance to friedrichstr. and - if you don't mind walking a bit further - the brandenburg gate. The interior decoration of the hotel is quirky (including a full suit of armour on the stairs) but utterly charming and the staff were friendly to a fault. We will definitely use this hotel again when I return to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Berlin's Best Kept Secret!”
Reviews.Author: Leighcote
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended to me by a German colleague and it didn't fail to disappoint. Only a 5 minute walk from Invalidenstr. underground station, this hotel doesn't look much from the outside but don't be put off! They have a fabulous court garden, peaceful and relaxing, where you can sit and enjoy breakfast or merely enjoy your surroundings. We asked for one of the "garden rooms", a little row of double rooms with bathroom, situated directly at the side of the garden. After a busy day sightseeing in Berlin, this hotel is the perfect tonic. Staff are pleasant and courteous. There is also a lounge where you can retire to for a quiet evening drink before heading off for the bright city lights! N.B. At the time of our visit, credit cards were NOT accepted. Only cash or debit cards (e.g. Switch, Maestro etc.).

Reviews.Title: “I have some doubts”
Reviews.Author: ehelgason
Reviews.Content: The Honingmond hotel looks very inviting on the web. It has a good location on the busy Invalidenstrasse in East-Berlin. Its pride is a lovely garden which lies in the back of the house, quite idyllic. For the first nights we stayed in a very spacious suite on the top floor - there is no lift so the climb up there was quite strenous. So far, so good. The room had some pretty furninture. The last night we had to move to a smaller room on the third floor. This was altogether different - I noticed that all the furninture in this room was cheap, standard IKEA. But the weakest point of the Honingmond is the service, which I found rather confusing and unprofessional. My wife lost her expensive Chanel sunglasses in the hotel - we are almost sure they were stolen from the room - but the staff did not take this seriously in any way. I found that rather dissapointing for what is, ultimately, quite a nice place.
